unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Purple Candies
question_text: A company published its percentages for colors of candy included in its jumbo packs.  Here they are: red orange yellow green blue purple $0.10$ $0.30$ $0.25$ $0.05$ $0.15$ $0.15$ A firm was hired to perform a chi-square goodness of fit test.  What is the alternative hypothesis and what is the expected number of purple candies given there were $40$ bags randomly selected which included $960$ total candies sampled?

choices.text: H a H a :   The proportions of colors in the jumbo bags is the same as what the company claims. Expected number of purple candies: 6 6
H a H a :  The proportions of colors in the jumbo bags is not the same as what the company claims. Expected number of purple candies: 6 6
H a H a :  The proportions of colors in the jumbo bags is not the same as what the company claims. Expected number of purple candies: 144 144
H a H a :  The proportions of candy colors should all be the same. Expected number of purple candies: 144 144
H a H a :  The proportions of colors in the jumbo bags is the same as what the company claims. Expected number of purple candies: 96 96
